data.text: @BurgerLab12 @Joe460 @HighWireTalk It says 81% are worried about its “newness”, 82% worried about side effects and 45% of those were not college educated. I’m assuming those being CNA’s or administrative positions. Also as a nurse, I’m not a science denier. I would be crazy not to question it.

@GinaDamico10 @Joe460 @HighWireTalk Its fair to ask Qs and want more info, of course. But read the article. It says most (80%) plan to get the vax, and most of those who don't want it are less educated workers. So we need to educate that 20%.
@Joe460 @GinaDamico10 @HighWireTalk Literally every poll says you're wrong. You probably just hang out with other science deniers.

@HighWireTalk Dr Byram Bridle (Viral Immunologist), Dr Knut Wittkowski (Epidemiologis) and Dr Mike Yeadon (Former Vice President and Chief Science Officer for Pfizer) passed comment on @GVDBossche mass vaccination danger claims. 
👉https://t.co/6FCBAzrHWv

@HighWireTalk The biggest news of this year is the EUA announcement in re blood clots (Phys. learn and know how to treat). "Similarly, on average 1.35 cases of CVST might have been expected among this age group whereas by the same cut-off date there had been 12."

https://t.co/ccLs7CzZ6G
@HighWireTalk I wonder how widespread vaccine hesitancy is?

@HighWireTalk Dr Byram Bridle (Viral Immunologist), Dr Knut Wittkowski (Epidemiologis) and Dr Mike Yeadon (Former Vice President and Chief Science Officer for Pfizer) passed comment on Geert Vanden Bossche mass vaccination danger claims https://t.co/6FCBAzrHWv

@Joe460 @HighWireTalk Not a cum figure...if it adds up to that, I guess. I think it's 20% of the adult pop in US at this point got at least 1.

But is this the new plan? The vaccines rolls out, the vast majority get it and then you'll just go into denial mode and say ppl didn't actually get it? 😂😂😂

@BurgerLab12 @HighWireTalk So ⅓ of USA has had the jab?
You should take up comedy! 🤣🤣🤣
@HighWireTalk Losing hearts & minds is the first stage ✌🏼
